instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_CSO_N: What is CHGR_CSO_N? CHGR_CSO_N is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_N and CHGR_CSO_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_P: What is CHGR_CSO_P? CHGR_CSO_P is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_P and CHGR_CSO_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message:
Getting 1.6v on <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P</SIGNAL>
0v on <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>
0v on <SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE</SIGNAL>

Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> once and it burnt out and I lost the pad on <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL> so there is a now a jumper from that pin of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: check value for <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>, also check traces between those resistors, ISL and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>...  Resistance between 17/18 should be about 3ohm and between 27/28 should be about 20ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> goes down slowly to about 1ohm, 1.6v
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> 322ohm, 1.6v
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> 38mohm, 16.8v
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> 3.9kohm, 16.8v
<RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> 0.6ohm, 1.6v
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> 0.6ohm, 16.8v

The trace between <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> and pin 17 has been destroyed and has a copper wire going to it now. All other traces seem fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: after copper wire and replacing <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> does it work?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: I hope you are not measuring resistance with power applied.... see schematic and tell me if the resistance value of each resistor is right....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: Did you even compare the resistor values to the schematic?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message:
Aprendiz, no power whilst measuring resistance.

Duke, I did compare and then did the following based on that:

I'd already swapped out <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> before I saw your message, and then swapped out <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>. I got an orange light and it was charging for a couple of minutes then all of a sudden the mouse moved very laggy and the orange light went off. <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is now getting very hot when the power is plugged in. Also, it appears my charger died during all this. I have another though. Any particular readings you want me to take at this point, bearing in mind that <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is getting very hot very quickly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message:
I bet the charger just tripped. Unplug and wait.
ISL probably dead again, replace it and also replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/35. Check traces to the gates of these FETs too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: Ok, what I'm finding now is that I have continuity between pins 1 and 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>, even on the pads when I lift the cap off. Remember, <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL> had a jumper going to <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>. Well, even with that jumper off and <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> off I'm getting a short on the test points of <SIGNAL>CSO_N</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CSO_P</SIGNAL>. What could be causing that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: Look at the diagram and tell me why you should indeed measure about 2.2 Ohm across <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: Ahhh <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> is less than the continuity beep! Ok, thanks! Is it ok to use ISL6259A on this board even though the schematic says <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light
threads.message: ISL6259AHRTZ is what all these boards use from 2010 and upwards.
